author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment. You can edit blocking comments, adding `[noblock]` to them in order to unblock auto-merging.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->
[noblock] Is the "IST" part of an acronym? Wouldn't `SuperLUDist` be the more expected name, otherwise?

@goerz per the naming guidelines [noblock]:

> Packages that wrap external libraries or programs should be named after those libraries or programs.

[noblock] Ok... I think you may have to edit [your comment](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/85821#issuecomment-1596966718) to include `[noblock]` in order for the automatic merging to continue
[noblock] DIST could still be spelled Dist tho?

MATLAB.jl, ScaLAPACK.jl instead of ScaLAPack.jl, CuTENSOR.jl, CUSPARSE.jl, NNPACK.jl. 

This isn't universally followed of course, Sundials.jl for instance. 

But this will be an officially listed project on the SuperLU homepage, matching as much as possible is preferred ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è.
[noblock] Just because other packages have terrible fortran style names doesnt mean you have to...
